intro: Peixotoa cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba pampa grass, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Peixotoa cordobensis is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
